name: oj-paging-control
description: Provides paging functionality for data collections.

data.description:
The data to bind to the PagingControl.

Must implement the oj.PagingModel interface PagingModel

maxCount.description:
The maximum number items to display.
See the load-more-options attribute for usage examples.

loadMore.description: Display paging control in high watermark mode.

page.description: Display paging control in pagination mode.

overflow.description: Options for when the PagingControl width is too narrow to accommodate the controls in the paging control

fit.description: Display as many controls as can fit in the PagingControl width.

none.description: Display all controls. Controls which cannot fit will be truncated.

layout.description:
Array of paging navigation controls to be displayed (only applicable for numbers type).
This is an array of one or more supported values.
See the page-options attribute for usage examples.

auto.description: The PagingControl decides which controls to display

rangeText.description: Display the page range text control

maxPageLinks.description:
The maximum number of page links to display (only applicable for numbers type).
An ellipsis '...' will be displayed for pages which exceed the maximum.
maxPageLinks must be greater than 4.
See the page-options attribute for usage examples.

orientation.description:
The orientation of the page links.
See the page-options attribute for usage examples.

type.description:
The type of page links.
See the page-options attribute for usage examples.

translations.description:
A collection of translated resources from the translation bundle, or null if this
component has no resources. Resources may be accessed and overridden individually or collectively, as seen in the examples. If the component does not contain any translatable resource, the default value of this attribute will be 
null. If not, an object containing all resources relevant to the component.

If this component has translations, their documentation immediately follows this doc entry.

labelAccNavFirstPage.description:
First page label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAccNavLastPage.description:
Last page label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAccNavNextPage.description:
Next page label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAccNavPage.description:
Current page label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAccNavPreviousPage.description:
Previous page label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelAccPaging.description:
Paging control label for screen readers.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelLoadMore.description:
Load more link text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelLoadMoreMaxRows.description:
Label for when load more has reached the maximum limit of rows to fetch.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelNavInputPage.description:
Current page label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

labelNavInputPageMax.description:
Maximum page label.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

maxPageLinksInvalid.description:
Invalid max page links value error.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeCurrent.description:
Item range text for known row count.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeCurrentSingle.description:
Item range text for single page range.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeItems.description:
Item range items text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeOf.description:
Item range "of" text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeOfApprox.description:
Item range "of approx" text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

msgItemRangeOfAtLeast.description:
Item range "of at least" text.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

pageInvalid.description:
Invalid page error.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.
pageInvalid.value: The page value entered is invalid.

tipNavFirstPage.description:
First page button tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

tipNavInputPage.description:
Current page tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

tipNavLastPage.description:
Last page button tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

tipNavNextPage.description:
Next page button tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

tipNavPageLink.description:
Current page link tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

tipNavPreviousPage.description:
Previous page button tip.

See the translations attribute for usage examples.

firstPage.description: Load the first page of data

previousPage.description: Load the previous page of data

nextPage.description: Load the next page of data

lastPage.description: Load the last page of data

page.description: Load the specified page of data

loadNext.description: Load the next set of data

setProperty.description:
Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component
of the change, triggering a [property]Changed event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

getProperty.description: Retrieves a value for a property or a single subproperty for complex properties.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

setProperties.description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

contextMenu.description:
The contextMenu slot is set on the oj-menu within this element. 
This is used to designate the JET Menu that this component should launch as a context menu on right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific gesture. 
If specified, the browser's native context menu will be replaced by the JET Menu specified in this slot.

The application can register a listener for the Menu's ojBeforeOpen event. The listener can cancel the launch via event.preventDefault(), 
or it can customize the menu contents by editing the menu DOM directly, and then calling refresh() on the Menu.

To help determine whether it's appropriate to cancel the launch or customize the menu, the ojBeforeOpen listener can use component API's to determine which 
table cell, chart item, etc., is the target of the context menu. See the JSDoc and demos of the individual components for details. 

Keep in mind that any such logic must work whether the context menu was launched via right-click, Shift-F10, Press & Hold, or component-specific touch gesture.
